message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS 

The paper presents an information-theoretic framework for estimating the number of labeled samples needed to train a classifier in a Bayesian setting. It uses ideas from rate-distortion theory to derive bounds for the average L1 or L∞ distance between the learned classifier and the true maximum a posteriori classifier in terms of information-theoretic quantities and the number of training samples available. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including Information Theory (cs.IT), Machine Learning (cs.LG), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS).
